name: Bioinformatics Data Integration Practicum
long_desc: This course provides a handson, selfdirected experience dealing with biological data and integrating it to produce software and analyses that are of use to biologists. Data are taken from a variety of sources, including academic research labs, large scale public genomics projects and data from private industry partners. Students will be given a project and asked to design a solution using a combination of existing tools and their own developed software.

custom_fields.assessment_structure: Graded based on written reports, a final pipeline product, a final oral presentation, an interview with the instructor, and peer evaluations
custom_fields.relevance: This course is directly relevant to real-world bioinformatic processes and analyses used in research and industry.
custom_fields.learning_resources: The instructor distributes primary literature and lecture slides via Canvas.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Students meet outside of class to work with their teams. But, overall the time required is equivalent to 6 units in a mini course.
